content.text:
# List of Yugoslav World War II monuments and memorials in Montenegro

List of World War II monuments and memorials in the Montenegro represent Yugoslav monuments and memorials built on the territory of the present day Montenegro.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
!style=background:#FFDEAD;| Image
!style=background:#FFDEAD;| Name
!style=background:#FFDEAD;| Location
!style=background:#FFDEAD;| Notes
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
| style="text-align:center;"| Monument to the partisan soldier
| style="text-align:center;"| Podgorica
| style="text-align:center;"| Designed by Drago Đurović and Vojislav Đokić, built in 1957. Dedicated to 97 People's heroes of Montenegro
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
| style="text-align:center;"| Partisan graveyard in Breza
| style="text-align:center;"| Breza
| style="text-align:center;"| Designed by Momčilo Vujisić, built in 1974. Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to Freedom
|| Berane
|| Designed by Bogdan Bogdanović, and opened in 1977. Located on Jasikovac hill, on the outskirts of the town.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Partisan graveyard in Podbišće
|| Podbišće
|| Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Memorial graveyard in Cijevna
|| Cijevna
|| Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
| style="text-align:center;"| Memorial park to the Uprising and the Revolution
| style="text-align:center;"| Grahovo
| style="text-align:center;"| Designed by Miodrag Živković, built in 1978. Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to fallen fighters
|| Bijelo Polje
|| Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to fallen fighters
|| Brajići
|| Designed by Stevan Luketić, dedicated to fallen fighters of the 1875-1918 liberation wars and the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to fallen fighters
|| Brskut
|| Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Balkan wars and the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to fallen fighters
|| Godinje
|| Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
| style="text-align:center;"| Monument to fallen fighters
| style="text-align:center;"| Danilovgrad
| style="text-align:center;"| Designed by Drago Đurović and Mirko Đokić. Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to fallen fighters
|| Kolašin
|| Designed by Vojin Bakić, built in 1949. Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to the Revolution
|| Virpazar
|| Designed by Mirko Ostoja. Dedicated to fallen fighters of the Yugoslav Front.
|- style="text-align:center;"
||
|| Monument to fallen patriots
|| Nikšić
|| Designed by Bogdan Bogdanović. Dedicated to 32 anti-fascists and patriots shot by the occupiers on Trebjesa hill
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
|| Memorial to the liberation of Herceg Novi
|| Herceg Novi
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
|| ''Monument to the People's Hero of Yugoslavia Nikola Đurković in Herceg Novi.
|| Herceg Novi
||
|-
| style="text-align:center;"|
|| Monument for heroes fallen for freedom''
|| Kotor
